intro: Talinum dauphinense, commonly known as the pink-root or red-root plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Talinum dauphinense is also valued for its edible leaves, which are used in local cuisines.
